title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response only includes the first criterion below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state an increase in government spending, a decrease in taxes, or an increase in transfer payments.
The response states an increase in government spending, a decrease in taxes, or an increase in transfer payments.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the minimum change in investment spending as $50 billion and/or does not show the work.

Minimum Change in Investment Spending=  $200 billion ( 1 0.25 ) =$50 billion MathType@MTEF@5@5@@75E6@

The response calculates the minimum change in investment spending as $50 billion and shows the work.

Minimum Change in Investment Spending=  $200 billion ( 1 0.25 ) =$50 billion MathType@MTEF@5@5@@75E6@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not show the short-run effect of the change in investment spending as a rightward shift of the aggregate demand curve, resulting in a higher equilibrium price level and higher equilibrium real output that is less than full-employment output, labeled PL 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3877@ and Y 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeywamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaaaaa@37B1@ respectively.

The response shows the short-run effect of the change in investment spending as a rightward shift of the aggregate demand curve, resulting in a higher equilibrium price level and higher equilibrium real output that is less than full-employment output, labeled PL 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3877@ and Y 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeywamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaaaaa@37B1@ respectively.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the actual rate of unemployment is greater than the natural rate of unemployment and/or does not explain that the economy is still in a recessionary gap.
The response states that the actual rate of unemployment is greater than the natural rate of unemployment and explains that the economy is still in a recessionary gap.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
